com.storageroomapp.client

Class Entry

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GenericField<?>>
        • com.storageroomapp.client.Entry
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GenericField<?>>

    public class Entry
extends java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,GenericField<?>>
    The Entry object represents an entry in a collection. Entry objects are normally obtained via querys to collections (see how in the CollectionEntries class).

    When you wish to GET or CREATE an Entry, see the CollectionEntries class for methods to enable just that.

    To UPDATE or DELETE a particular entry, this object offers methods to do that.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entry

        protected Entry(Collection parent)
        Public callers should not be creating raw Entry objects. When creating new entries, callers should instead retrieve an Entry object populated with the Field metadata for the associated Collection. The CollectionEntries object does just that.
        Parameters:
        parent -

    • Method Detail

      • parseJSONObject

        public static Entry parseJSONObject(Collection parent,
                    org.json.simple.JSONObject jsonObj)
        Unmarshalls an Entry object from a JSONObject. This method assumes the name-values are immediately attached to the passed object and not nested under a key (e.g. 'entry')
        Parameters:
        jsonObj - the JSONObject
        Returns:
        an Entry object, or null if the unpacking failed

      • delete

        public boolean delete()
        This method makes a live request to the StorageRoom API to delete this Entry.

        After a successful delete, it may be okay to continue using this object for offline purposes. It is not recommended to subsequently reuse this same object in an insert call. Residual state within this object may cause that operation to fail.

        SERVER ROUND TRIP: this is a live API call

        Returns:
        true if the delete succeeded, false if not
